update.description:
Implement `SimbodyPhysics::SetParam` based on the specification in SDF. Part of [issue1116](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1116/update-simbody-physics-parameters-add), though not a complete fix (still need to fully implement `SimbodyPhysics::GetParam`).

I also removed a lot of code from the physics engine implementations by making a static templated helper function in PhysicsEngine to catch exceptions from boost::any_cast.

[Jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/561/)

pullrequest.title: Implemented SimbodyPhysics::SetParam and slimmed down physics engines

content.raw:
I think there is a solution here that could save a lot of lines of code, but I haven't implemented it optimally here if we want to report every error at the location of its incidence.

It seems to me that because `boost::any`'s type can be queried with [type_info](http://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_57_0/doc/html/boost/any.html), and SDF Params can report their type with [GetType](http://osrf-distributions.s3.amazonaws.com/sdformat/api/dev/classsdf_1_1Param.html#a3ff27eafd928dedc961cd8371388ff69), the SetParam functions could check once at the beginning of the function that the type of the parameter represented by `_key` and the type of `_value` as reported by `boost::any::type_info` agree, and return false with an error message if they do not.

If you prefer, I can revert this PR so that it only implements `SimbodyPhysics::SetParam`, and save the optimizations for future work.

@scpeters, what are your thoughts here?
content.html:
I think there is a solution here that could save a lot of lines of code, but I haven't implemented it optimally here if we want to report every error at the location of its incidence.

It seems to me that because boost::any's type can be queried with type_info, and SDF Params can report their type with GetType, the SetParam functions could check once at the beginning of the function that the type of the parameter represented by _key and the type of _value as reported by boost::any::type_info agree, and return false with an error message if they do not.

If you prefer, I can revert this PR so that it only implements SimbodyPhysics::SetParam, and save the optimizations for future work.

@scpeters, what are your thoughts here?

pullrequest.title: Implemented SimbodyPhysics::SetParam and slimmed down physics engines

content.html:
I'm having doubts about the usefulness of the abstract any cast functions. The difference in code will be minimal.

Without the custom any cast functions:

if (!AnyCast(x,x,x))
{
  Handle the error
}

compared with:

try
{
  boost::any_cast ...
}
catch(boost::bad_any &_e)
{
  Handle error
}

With the abstract class we'd have to output two error messages. One for the catch inside AnyCast that outputs e.what() and one for the if around the AnyCast that captures the context for the error.

It appears that it's safe to assume that an integer value physics parameter is also an unsigned integer, however...?

content.raw:
The change in 5eed9b4 causes a compilation error for me:

```
In file included from /usr/include/sdformat-2.2/sdf/Param.hh:26:0,
                 from /usr/include/sdformat-2.2/sdf/sdf.hh:6,
                 from /home/jackie/code/gazebo/test/ServerFixture.hh:29,
                 from /home/jackie/code/gazebo/gazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc:18:
/usr/include/boost/any.hpp: In instantiation of ‘boost::any::holder<ValueType>::holder(const ValueType&) [with ValueType = char [6]]’:
/usr/include/boost/any.hpp:52:49:   required from ‘boost::any::any(const ValueType&) [with ValueType = char [6]]’
/home/jackie/code/gazebo/gazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc:109:5:   required from here
/usr/include/boost/any.hpp:169:27: error: array used as initializer
               : held(value)
```

Instantiating the "wrong" parameter as a `std::string` fixes it.
content.html:
The change in 5eed9b4 causes a compilation error for me:

In file included from /usr/include/sdformat-2.2/sdf/Param.hh:26:0,
                 from /usr/include/sdformat-2.2/sdf/sdf.hh:6,
                 from /home/jackie/code/gazebo/test/ServerFixture.hh:29,
                 from /home/jackie/code/gazebo/gazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc:18:
/usr/include/boost/any.hpp: In instantiation of ‘boost::any::holder<ValueType>::holder(const ValueType&) [with ValueType = char [6]]’:
/usr/include/boost/any.hpp:52:49:   required from ‘boost::any::any(const ValueType&) [with ValueType = char [6]]’
/home/jackie/code/gazebo/gazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc:109:5:   required from here
/usr/include/boost/any.hpp:169:27: error: array used as initializer
               : held(value)

Instantiating the "wrong" parameter as a std::string fixes it.

I have two proposed changes in branch `simbody_setparam_scpeters`:

* 5eed9b4 improve readability of catch message and add statement to PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc that tries to SetParam with an incorrect type
content.html:
I have two proposed changes in branch simbody_setparam_scpeters:

  • 1876fae add EXPECT_TRUE to SetParam calls in ODEPhysics_TEST.cc (not 100% related, but I saw it while I was reading through related code)
  • 5eed9b4 improve readability of catch message and add statement to PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc that tries to SetParam with an incorrect type

content.raw:
I like these functions, but I'm wondering if it will be hard to figure out which parameter caused the exception?

For comparison, in [ODEJoint::SetParam](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/e39d49524b1ebe9ded9a337b60559788ef723da1/gazebo/physics/ode/ODEJoint.cc?at=gazebo5#cl-394), I wrapped the entire block in a try/catch and print the SetParam `_key` field in the error message. Maybe add `_key` as a function argument to `AnyCast` so it can be printed in the error message? Feels weird, but is useful for debugging.
content.html:
I like these functions, but I'm wondering if it will be hard to figure out which parameter caused the exception?

For comparison, in ODEJoint::SetParam, I wrapped the entire block in a try/catch and print the SetParam _key field in the error message. Maybe add _key as a function argument to AnyCast so it can be printed in the error message? Feels weird, but is useful for debugging.
